content:
Yes, there are many other designers and artists who have had a significant impact on a band's visual identity. One such artist is Storm Thorgerson, who is known for his work designing album covers for bands such as Pink Floyd, Led Zeppelin, and Muse. He was a founding member of the prominent graphic design firm Hipgnosis, which created some of the most iconic album covers of the 20th century. His surreal and imaginative artwork has played a significant role in shaping the visual identity of these bands and has become synonymous with their music.

Another artist who has made a significant contribution to a band's visual identity is Vaughan Oliver, who designed album covers for the British post-punk band, Cocteau Twins. His distinct use of typography and striking imagery helped establish the band's unique aesthetic and visual identity.

Finally, Peter Saville's work for Joy Division and New Order, influenced the development and popularization of the minimalist design aesthetic, which was an important part of the visual identity of both bands.
